TopicTitle: KSP real life (near 1:1 scale) stock aircraft (downloads)

Articles.Content:
http://www.mediafire.com/file/zx5646vtza0t99d/B-52+H+(FINISHED).craft - B52H

http://www.mediafire.com/file/4ati6ko1ybj1gzw/B-52+H+(X-15+att_).craft - B52H + X-15 attachment

http://www.mediafire.com/file/sbjz2bxrimcdbe2/Vampire+FB5.craft - Vampire FB5

http://www.mediafire.com/file/0q40u1ws8twfl0k/X-15.craft - X-15 

http://www.mediafire.com/file/vx1mchok9rugkvb/Sukhoi+Su-27.craft - Sukhoi SU-27

http://www.mediafire.com/file/8kpf7zpcbdp9mv2/Lockheed+F-104+Starfighter.craft - Lockheed F-104 Starfighter

http://www.mediafire.com/file/4czaadazo2a9w7u/F-16.craft F-16

http://www.mediafire.com/file/zfqtopfdyytc3iw/Eurofighter+Typhoon.craft - Eurofighter Typhoon

http://www.mediafire.com/file/is1mraqazd3312l/Concorde.craft - Concorde

http://www.mediafire.com/file/x2ywwrbxrjuxwfg/CF-18+Hornet.craft - CF-18 Hornet

 

My planes are entirely free to download, and require no mods to use. Though I do warn that a few of them (Concorde and B52) are very large planes and have a lot of parts on them. They all do fly, as I have done many tests with each and every one of them, developing and making changes where needed.

And as added in the title, they are near 1:1 scale planes.

 

Have fun!

-TheKorbinger

 

 

 

Edited December 4, 2016 by TheKorbinger

Hello TheKorbinger and welcome to our forum.

Unfortunately, Mediafire links will not work here. Please host your files on another service and re-submit them.

Sounds cool, but any pictures? The general rule around here is no pics, no clicks. You can press F2 in-game to hide the HUD, and then use PrintScreen to save the image to your clipboard, then upload it to Imgur and paste direct image links to the image in the post.

My planes are entirely free to download, and require no mods to use. Though I do warn that a few of them (Concorde and B52) are very large planes and have a lot of parts on them. They all do fly, as I have done many tests with each and every one of them, developing and making changes where needed.

And as added in the title, they are near 1:1 scale planes.

 

Have fun!
